meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a powerful wallop to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent2: The wallop from the hammer echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated wallop on the toy hammer made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The storm's wallop on the coast left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The wallop of the falling tree branch startled the hikers.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: She managed to wallop the ball out of the park with her strong swing.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a mallet to wallop the chicken breasts for tenderness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to wallop the toy mouse but missed every time.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind seemed to wallop the umbrella inside out.
meanings.sent5: The superhero wallop the villain with a single punch.

meanings.sent1: The team was able to wallop their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The army's strategy was to wallop the enemy forces swiftly and effectively.
meanings.sent3: The student managed to wallop the difficult math problem after hours of studying.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie wallop the audience's expectations.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team wallop the reigning champions in a surprising victory.
